gov.usgs.cwbquery

Class QuerySpan

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.cwbquery.QuerySpan

  • public final class QuerySpan
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represent a time series chunk which is filled with specified value if data is missing. The idea is to allow creation, population by a series of blocks which may not be contiguous or even in order. Constructors needs to deal with different data types and construction methods. Initially, this class assumed it would be created from a list of mini-seed blocks. However, it is quite likely it will need to be extended to allow a pre-allocation followed by many calls adding data to the time series. Part of the expansion was to support rolling buffers where the data is shifted down so that the duration remains the same, but the start time keeps rolling forward with the buffer remaining consistent. This is used by the QueryRing extending class to support time series from continuous calculation, while hiding the details of where data population from the user.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuerySpan

        public QuerySpan(java.lang.String host,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String seedname,
                 long st,
                 double dur,
                 double preDur,
                 double rate,
                 EdgeThread parent)
        Creates a new instance of QueryRing used by the realtime memory buffer system. It expects to be loaded by realTimeLoad() and calls to addRealTime() rather than by being populated by queries generated by getData() calls.
        Parameters:
        host - The host where the query server is running, if null or "", its gcwb.cr.usgs.gov
        port - The port where the cwb is running, if zero, defaults to 2061
        seedname - The NSCL form of the channel name
        st - The starting time for the initialization as Millis since epoch
        dur - The length of the ring buffer in seconds.
        preDur - the length of time before the "real time" to make sure is available
        rate - If known, if not it will be captured when first data is laoded
        parent - The EdgeThread to log through

        public long getMillisAt(int i)
        REturn the time in millis of the given sample bin. This returns the values from the TimesDataCollection to get a accurate time over long intervals. If that system is empty (no times in the collection yet), this returns the time based on start time and nominal sample rate.
        Parameters:
        i - the offset in the buffer that the time is need
        Returns:
        The time of the ith sample.

      • getTimeOfNextDataAfter

        public long getTimeOfNextDataAfter(long afterTime)
        Return the time of the next actual data after the given time. If the remainder of the buffers is fill values, then return the time of the last sample. Useful for jumping through long gaps.
        Parameters:
        afterTime - The time to consider as the beginning of the gap.
        Returns:
        The time of the first real data sample in the buffer, or the time of the last fill value

      • getData

        public int getData(java.util.GregorianCalendar starting,
                   int needed,
                   int[] d,
                   boolean allowGaps)
        This returns an array of data for a given time and number of samples. The start time given is updated to the actual time of the first sample
        Parameters:
        starting - Time desired of the first sample
        needed - Number of samples desired
        d - An array of ints to receive the data
        allowGaps -
        Returns:
        Number of samples returned or -1 if data is not in this buffer

      • getData

        public int getData(java.util.GregorianCalendar starting,
                   int needed,
                   double[] d,
                   boolean allowGaps)
        This returns an array of data for a given time and number of samples. The start time given is updated to the actual time of the first sample
        Parameters:
        starting - Time desired of the first sample
        needed - Number of samples desired
        d - An array of doubles to receive the data
        allowGaps - If true, data return might include fille values, if not, then returned data is shortened to first fill
        Returns:
        Number of samples returned or -1 if data is not in this buffer

        public int getData(int[] d,
                   int off,
                   int len)
        get a chunk of the data into an array,
        Parameters:
        d - The array to put the data in
        off - The offset in the internal data buffer to start
        len - The maximum length of data to return (d must be dimensioned >len)
        Returns:
        The number of samples actually returned <=len

      • getNsamp

        public int getNsamp()
        get number of data samples in time series (many might be fills). This is the length of the internal buffer from the original setup of the duration. If a larger time series is loaded via the refill() method, this value will grow to that size. So, it represents the duration of this buffer in samples.
        Returns:
        Number of samples in series

      • hasGapsBeforeEnd

        public boolean hasGapsBeforeEnd()
        return true if any portion of the allocated space has a "no data" or fill value. Trim number of samples to reflect actual sample if end contains some no data points.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least on missing data value

      • refill

        public void refill(java.util.ArrayList<MiniSeed> list,
                   java.util.GregorianCalendar trim,
                   double dur)
        Replace this with the data on this list. Make the data bigger if the duration calls for it, this can be used to reuse one of these objects for totally unrelated data
        Parameters:
        list - Of miniSeed blocks to put in the span
        trim - Trim data to this time as the beginning
        dur - The duration of seconds of the buffer.

      • shiftAddTSB

        public void shiftAddTSB(java.util.ArrayList<TimeSeriesBlock> list,
                        long begin,
                        long end,
                        double shiftLength)
        Shift the buffer so that shiftLength seconds of data before the first data time in the list of new blocks is in the buffer before the first time. That is the first time has shiftLen seconds of data before the first sample in the new data.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of miniseed blocks to add to this span
        begin - Limit on the earliest time to shift to (it can be no earlier this time - shiftLength
        end - End time limit
        shiftLength - The amount of old data before first new data to leave in the buffer

      • addRealTime

        public void addRealTime(MiniSeed ms,
                        double shiftLength)
        Shift the buffer so that shiftLength seconds of data before the first data time in the list of new blocks is in the buffer before the first time. That is the first time has shiftLen seconds of data before the first sample in the new data.
        Parameters:
        ms - A miniSEED block to add to this span
        shiftLength - The amount of old data before first new data to leave in the buffer

      • addRealTime

        public boolean addRealTime(long st,
                           int[] samples,
                           int ns,
                           double shiftLength)

      • testRunsList

        public boolean testRunsList(java.lang.StringBuilder sb2)

      • makeTraceBuf

        public void makeTraceBuf(long start,
                         double duration,
                         TraceBufPool tbp,
                         java.util.ArrayList<TraceBuf> tbs)
        Return as many trace bufs as can be made from this span within the time limits. Designed for use in CWBQuery server so a TraceBufPools is required for allocations and the user passes in the ArrayList to get the results. Data on list will be in order.
        Parameters:
        start - Return as many trace bufs starting after this time
        duration - Duration of the request
        tbp - A pool to use to allocate tracebufs
        tbs - The users array list to get the results.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
